TopicTitle: Do you have a screenshot that makes you laugh every time?

Articles.Content:
> 
> 
> On 6/9/2016 at 10:35 AM, cbplayer2012 said:
> 
> 
> I once tried to build a space kraken from the hangar
> 
> 
> 
> 
> It bloody blew up the mission control building from the hangar.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> [![X2D6HF8.png](http://i.imgur.com/X2D6HF8.png)](http://i.imgur.com/X2D6HF8.png "Enlarge image")
> 

OK, what **are** you people doing?  I keep seeing people firing rockets, wrecking things, and generally causing havoc inside the VAB itself.  I'm going to be disappointed if this is just a mod ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif ":P")

> 
> 
> 14 minutes ago, Corona688 said:
> 
> 
> OK, what **are** you people doing?  I keep seeing people firing rockets, wrecking things, and generally causing havoc inside the VAB itself.  I'm going to be disappointed if this is just a mod ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif ":P")
> 

This will ruin the magic:

Spoiler

![jQq9p7M.png?1](http://i.imgur.com/jQq9p7M.png?1)

Yep, whack-a-kerbal works in the SPH & VAB.

> 
> 
> 7 hours ago, cubinator said:
> 
> 
> I'd like to read a technical paper written by a Kerbal.
> 

[Here you go.](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/141981-kerbal-term-paper-nerva/)

![kx2S65W.png](http://i.imgur.com/kx2S65W.png)

I was doing some flying and stuff, and then somehow it came to this.

![Kx8yEF5.png](http://i.imgur.com/Kx8yEF5.png)

I was experimenting with some very low size heightmaps to see if I could find alternate ways of making oblate spheroids, triaxial ellipsoids, and prolate spheroids. This was a 2x1 texture that was a black pixel and a white pixel right next to each other, applied as a heightmap on Gilly. It was supposed to be an attempt at a tri-axial ellipsoid, but it didn't end up as such. I someone on the Kopernicus IRC (might have been [@Sigma88](%7B___base_url___%7D/index.php?/profile/113260-sigma88/)) said "It looks like a butt." So I said "But I don't *want* a butt." So every time I see this image it makes me laugh.

It's a seriously messed up butt if it is one.

this scared the hell out of me when I first saw it ingame, now it makes me smile when I see it

![JDb6NgF.png](http://i.imgur.com/JDb6NgF.png)

When a previously well behaved Rover takes exception to a visit from the vet........ or when you don't place that last wheel *just* right.

![screenshot72_zpsoc4zwukv.png](http://i382.photobucket.com/albums/oo265/glostersoul/KSP/screenshot72_zpsoc4zwukv.png)

> 
> 
> 1 minute ago, dangerhamster said:
> 
> 
> When a previously well behaved Rover takes exception to a visit from the vet........ or when you don't place that last wheel *just* right.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> [![screenshot72_zpsoc4zwukv.png](http://i382.photobucket.com/albums/oo265/glostersoul/KSP/screenshot72_zpsoc4zwukv.png)](http://i382.photobucket.com/albums/oo265/glostersoul/KSP/screenshot72_zpsoc4zwukv.png "Enlarge image")
> 

Run! Run for your life!

> 
> 
> On 6/16/2016 at 11:14 AM, dboi88 said:
> 
> 
> Yep that's all debris. I've still to this day no idea what happened. I docked the last piece of my interplanetary duna mission craft in orbit and all holy hell broke loose. Took me 2 weeks to build and another week to rebuild it.
> 

The only remotely similar thing I've experienced was when KSP had just added struts, which I exploited as heat sinks, building [massive pancakes of boosters](http://burningsmell.org/images/solid-hexagons.jpg).  A whole stack of sixty-four solids detonated as one when I ran them a smidgen too hot, and the middle stage just **vaporized**, but most of the top, far away not to get "overheated", survived as a cloud of disembodied engines, tanks, decouplers, and RCS nodes.  Not a single part was left connected to any other.

But the resulting airborne debris field was not hitting escape velocity in opposite directions, **mother of god!!**

**Edited <time datetime="2016-06-18T19:08:28Z" title="06/18/2016 07:08  PM" data-short="8 yr">June 18, 2016</time> by Corona688**

Jeb failed his driver's test *again*...

![SIbdt0G.png](http://i.imgur.com/SIbdt0G.png)The rover was really poorly built, and on collision (As you can see), completely underwent Rapid Unplanned Disassembly.

A mod, gone wrong.

Someone put a 'kerbal face' on Duna, like the famous 'face of mars', but the scale screwed up for whatever reason.

Yeah, take a look at the orbital altitude from which the screenshot was taken--150 meters? Not kilometers, 150 *meters*. That's a tiny planet, that is.
